code:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { onMounted, ref, triggerRef } from "vue";

const htmlEl: HTMLElement | null = document.querySelector("html");

let darkMode = ref({
  get state(): boolean {
    return htmlEl.classList.contains("dark");
  },

  set state(value: boolean) {
    toggleDarkClass(value);
  },
});

const toggleDarkClass = (value: boolean) => {
  if (value) {
    htmlEl.classList.add("dark");
  } else {
    htmlEl.classList.remove("dark");
  }
};
</script>

<template>
  <!-- ... -->
</template>

(alias) function ref<T>(value: T): [T] extends [Ref] ? IfAny<T, Ref<T>, T> : Ref<UnwrapRef<T>, UnwrapRef<T> | T> (+1 overload)
import ref
nodes.docs:
Takes an inner value and returns a reactive and mutable ref object, which
has a single property `.value` that points to the inner value.
tags: value - The object to wrap in the ref.

nodes.text:
(alias) function triggerRef(ref: Ref): void
import triggerRef
nodes.docs:
Force trigger effects that depends on a shallow ref. This is typically used
after making deep mutations to the inner value of a shallow ref.
tags: ref - The ref whose tied effects shall be executed.

nodes.docs:
Any HTML element. Some elements directly implement this interface, while others implement it via an interface that inherits it.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement)

Returns the first element that is a descendant of node that matches selectors.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Document/querySelector)

Takes an inner value and returns a reactive and mutable ref object, which
has a single property `.value` that points to the inner value.
tags: value - The object to wrap in the ref.

nodes.docs:
Allows for manipulation of element's class content attribute as a set of whitespace-separated tokens through a DOMTokenList object.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/classList)

Returns true if token is present, and false otherwise.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/DOMTokenList/contains)

Allows for manipulation of element's class content attribute as a set of whitespace-separated tokens through a DOMTokenList object.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/classList)

Adds all arguments passed, except those already present.

Throws a "SyntaxError" DOMException if one of the arguments is the empty string.

Throws an "InvalidCharacterError" DOMException if one of the arguments contains any ASCII whitespace.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/DOMTokenList/add)

Allows for manipulation of element's class content attribute as a set of whitespace-separated tokens through a DOMTokenList object.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/classList)

Removes arguments passed, if they are present.

Throws a "SyntaxError" DOMException if one of the arguments is the empty string.

Throws an "InvalidCharacterError" DOMException if one of the arguments contains any ASCII whitespace.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/DOMTokenList/remove)
